articles.basic_headline: Samsung Elec shares offered in $330 mln block sale, term sheet shows
articles.title: Samsung Elec shares offered in $330 mln block sale, term sheet shows
articles.description: About 5.25 million shares in Samsung Electronics are being offered in a block deal worth up to $330 million, according to a term sheet seen by Reuters on Monday.
articles.web: Samsung Elec shares offered in $330 mln block sale, term sheet shows

thumbnail.caption: A worker waters a flower bed next to the logo of Samsung Electronics during a media tour at Samsung Electronics' headquarters in Suwon, South Korea, June 13, 2023.  REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji/File Photo

thumbnail.subtitle: Samsung Electronic's HQ in Suwon, South Korea

articles.basic_headline: AI might rewrite Samsung's memory chip past
articles.title: AI might rewrite Samsung's memory chip past
articles.description: Samsung Electronics investors are used to the chip market's notoriously brutal boom-and-bust cycles. Artificial intelligence, though, might help ease future swings.
articles.web: AI might rewrite Samsung's memory chip past

thumbnail.caption: A person walks, at the Samsung stand during the 2024 Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona, Spain February 27, 2024. REUTERS/Albert Gea
thumbnail.alt_text: 2024 Mobile World Congress in Barcelona
thumbnail.subtitle: 2024 Mobile World Congress in Barcelona

articles.basic_headline: Samsung flags 10-fold rise in first-quarter profit as chip prices recover
articles.title: Samsung flags 10-fold rise in first-quarter profit as chip prices recover
articles.description: Samsung Electronics estimated on Friday its first-quarter operating profit would rise more than 10-fold, topping market expectations, as chip prices have started to rebound from a severe downturn thanks to a boom in artificial intelligence.
articles.web: Samsung flags 10-fold rise in first-quarter profit as chip prices recover

thumbnail.caption: A person walks, at the Samsung stand during the 2024 Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona, Spain February 27, 2024. REUTERS/Albert Gea
thumbnail.alt_text: 2024 Mobile World Congress in Barcelona
thumbnail.subtitle: 2024 Mobile World Congress in Barcelona

articles.basic_headline: Samsung profit likely biggest in six quarters on higher chip prices
articles.title: Samsung profit likely biggest in six quarters on higher chip prices
articles.description: Samsung Electronics is expected to post a near nine-fold increase in first-quarter profit from a year earlier as rebounding semiconductor prices lift earnings from a low base caused by a severe chip downturn.
articles.web: Samsung profit likely biggest in six quarters on higher chip prices

thumbnail.alt_text: Samsung Electronic's HQ in Suwon, South Korea
thumbnail.subtitle: Samsung Electronic's HQ in Suwon, South Korea

articles.basic_headline: India gives over $1 bln incentives to private firms under its manufacturing scheme,  official says
articles.title: India gives over $1 bln incentives to private firms under its manufacturing scheme,  official says
articles.description: India has paid $1.02 billion as incentives to boost local manufacturing, following over $13 billion in investments from private firms under a scheme introduced in 2020, a top government official said on Wednesday.
articles.web: India gives over $1 bln incentives to private firms under its manufacturing scheme,  official says

thumbnail.caption: Apple iPhones are seen inside India's first Apple retail store during a media preview, a day ahead of its launch in Mumbai, India, April 17, 2023. REUTERS/Francis Mascarenhas/File Photo

articles.basic_headline: Intel discloses $7 billion operating loss for chip-making unit
articles.title: Intel discloses $7 billion operating loss for chip-making unit
articles.description: Intel on Tuesday disclosed deepening operating losses for its foundry business, a blow to the chipmaker as it tries to regain a technology lead it lost in recent years to Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing .
articles.web: Intel discloses $7 billion operating loss for chip-making unit

thumbnail.caption: A man walks past the Intel logo at its booth during the first China International Supply Chain Expo (CISCE) in Beijing, China November 28, 2023. REUTERS/Florence Lo/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: China International Supply Chain Expo in Beijing
thumbnail.subtitle: China International Supply Chain Expo in Beijing

articles.basic_headline: TSMC's most complex engineering task is itself
articles.title: TSMC's most complex engineering task is itself
articles.description: Nvidia has ridden the wave of excitement about artificial intelligence to become the world’s third most valuable company. Yet founder Jensen Huang says the $2.3 trillion chip designer would not exist without Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing . His statement underscores how indispensable the $625 billion Taiwanese group is for the global technology industry.
articles.web: TSMC's most complex engineering task is itself

thumbnail.caption: A smartphone with a displayed TSMC (Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company) logo is placed on a computer motherboard in this illustration taken March 6, 2023. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

thumbnail.subtitle: Illustration shows TSMC (Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company) logo

articles.basic_headline: Aramco awards $7.7 bln in contracts for Fadhili gas expansion
articles.title: Aramco awards $7.7 bln in contracts for Fadhili gas expansion
articles.description: Saudi Aramco has awarded $7.7 billion in contracts to expand its Fadhili gas plant's processing capacity to 4 billion standard cubic feet per day, the company said on Tuesday.
articles.web: Aramco awards $7.7 bln in contracts for Fadhili gas expansion

articles.basic_headline: South Korea March exports up for sixth month on chip sales
articles.title: South Korea March exports up for sixth month on chip sales
articles.description: Robust demand for South Korean chips helped Asia's fourth-largest economy post export growth for a sixth consecutive month in March, albeit at a pace slightly slower than expected, pointing to continued recovery in the global economy.
articles.web: South Korea March exports up for sixth month on chip sales

thumbnail.alt_text: Samsung Electronics' chip production plant at Pyeongtaek
thumbnail.subtitle: Samsung Electronics' chip production plant at Pyeongtaek

articles.basic_headline: QatarEnergy to charter 19 new LNG vessels expanding fleet further
articles.title: QatarEnergy to charter 19 new LNG vessels expanding fleet further
articles.description: QatarEnergy (QATPE.UL) CEO Saad Al Kaabi announced on Sunday that the company has finalised a number of charter contracts with several Asian ship owners to bolster its shipping fleet by 19 LNG vessels ahead of a massive expansion in LNG output.
articles.web: QatarEnergy to charter 19 new LNG vessels expanding fleet further

articles.basic_headline: Samsung Pay to stop working with Russia's Mir payment system from April 3
articles.title: Samsung Pay to stop working with Russia's Mir payment system from April 3
articles.description: Samsung Pay, a payment service owned by South Korea's Samsung Electronics , will stop working with Russia's national Mir payment cards from April 3, the two payment systems said on Wednesday.
articles.web: Samsung Pay to stop working with Russia's Mir payment system from April 3

thumbnail.subtitle: St. Petersburg International Economic Forum (SPIEF)

articles.basic_headline: Vietnam boosts coal imports as it promises investors no more power cuts
articles.title: Vietnam boosts coal imports as it promises investors no more power cuts
articles.description: Vietnam's coal imports so far this year have nearly doubled from the same period of 2023, customs data shows, as the government strives to reassure foreign investors that factories will not face a repeat of last year's power shortages.
articles.web: Vietnam boosts coal imports as it promises investors no more power cuts

articles.basic_headline: Bosch, Lennox, Samsung vie for Johnson Controls HVAC assets, sources say
articles.title: Bosch, Lennox, Samsung vie for Johnson Controls HVAC assets, sources say
articles.description: Robert Bosch GmbH, Lennox International and Samsung Electronics are among the industrial firms competing to acquire heating and ventilation assets worth over $6 billion from Johnson Controls International , people familiar with the matter said on Friday.
articles.web: Bosch, Lennox, Samsung vie for Johnson Controls HVAC assets, sources say

thumbnail.caption: The logo and trading symbol for Johnson Controls International is displayed on a board on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, U.S., October 16, 2018. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid/File Photo

articles.basic_headline: Apple antitrust suit mirrors strategy that beat Microsoft, but tech industry has changed
articles.title: Apple antitrust suit mirrors strategy that beat Microsoft, but tech industry has changed
articles.description: The U.S. government's antitrust lawsuit against Apple draws on the watershed 1998 case that broke Microsoft's stranglehold on desktop software, but that may prove to be an imperfect blueprint for addressing smartphone competition.
articles.web: Apple antitrust suit mirrors strategy that beat Microsoft, but tech industry has changed

articles.basic_headline: Once a beacon of stability, Vietnam to name third president in a year
articles.title: What’s next for Vietnam after Vo Van Thuong resigns?
articles.description: Communist-ruled Vietnam is seeking its third president in little more than a year after the resignation of Vo Van Thuong, who was only elected last year after the sudden dismissal of his predecessor.
articles.web: What’s next for Vietnam after Vo Van Thuong resigns?

thumbnail.caption: Vietnam's President Vo Van Thuong speaks during a joint press conference with Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida (not pictured) at the prime minister's official residence in Tokyo, Japan November 27, 2023.     RICHARD A. BROOKS/Pool via REUTERS/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Vietnam's President Vo Van Thuong meets Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, in Tokyo
thumbnail.subtitle: Vietnam's President Vo Van Thuong meets Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, in Tokyo

articles.basic_headline: Intel readies for $100-bln spending spree across four US states
articles.title: Intel prepares for $100 billion spending spree across four US states
articles.description: Intel is planning a $100-billion spending spree across four U.S. states to build and expand factories after securing $19.5 billion in federal grants and loans - and hopes to secure another $25 billion in tax breaks.
articles.web: Intel prepares for $100 billion spending spree across four US states

articles.basic_headline: Intel latest to get US funds for chips, more grants and loans planned
articles.title: Intel latest to get US funds for chips, more grants and loans planned
articles.description: Intel Corp on Wednesday was the latest semiconductor company to be awarded billions of dollars in grants and loans from the U.S. government in President Joe Biden's effort to supercharge domestic chip output.
articles.web: Intel latest to get US funds for chips, more grants and loans planned

articles.basic_headline: Biden awards $19.5 billion in grants and loans to Intel to boost US chip output
articles.title: Intel clinches nearly $20 billion in awards from Biden to boost US chip output
articles.description: President Joe Biden awarded Intel nearly $20 billion in grants and loans on Wednesday, marking the U.S. government's largest outlay to subsidize leading-edge chip production and supercharging the company's domestic semiconductor chip output.
articles.web: Intel clinches nearly $20 billion in awards from Biden to boost US chip output

thumbnail.subtitle: U.S. President Joe Biden tours the Intel Ocotillo Campus, in Chandler

articles.basic_headline: Hedge fund Palliser hires former Elliott partner Kasoff
articles.title: Hedge fund Palliser hires former Elliott partner Kasoff
articles.description: UK hedge fund Palliser Capital is expanding into the U.S. and said on Wednesday it hired Steve Kasoff, bringing on board a former Elliott Investment Management partner to evaluate current and new opportunities in the United States.
articles.web: Hedge fund Palliser hires former Elliott partner Kasoff

articles.basic_headline: Samsung Elec expects $100 mln or more sales from advanced chip packaging business
articles.title: Samsung Electronics expects $100 million or more sales from advanced chip packaging business
articles.description: Samsung Electronics expects $100 million or more of revenue from its next batch of advanced chip-packaging products this year, co-CEO Kye-Hyun Kyung said on Wednesday.
articles.web: Samsung Electronics expects $100 million or more sales from advanced chip packaging business
